docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: WELCOME TO MY home and hospital,'' says Richard Wahlenmeier. This is Wahlenmeier's joke, but it's accurate. In his New York living room there are two couches, three shelves, a coffee table, wall-to-wall carpeting and, on the wood parquet by the front door, a metal pole supporting a computerized infusion pump and a bag of thick fluid.

byline.original: BY STEVE FISHMAN: Steve Fishman often writes on science and medicine. He is the author of ''A Bomb in the Brain.''
